channel.title: tir
channel.description: "Today I Read:" a collection of the little things you read each day. Cherish them!

item.title: Why Programmers Should(n't) Learn Theory
item.description: Ranks areas of theory from most useful (type theory) to least useful (category theory).

item.title: Dropping In on Gottfried Leibniz
item.description: Notes mostly on his archives, systems of notation, and (briefly) making sense of monadology

item.title: Whitewood Under Siege
item.description: The internal politics of pallet logistics ("the pallet wars").

item.title: The Life and Death of Cool
item.description: A truly scorched-earth posthumous review of Chet Baker.

item.title: The Liberals Who Can't Quit Lockdown
item.description: "Hygiene theater" is a good term, with all the right Foucauldian undertones.

item.title: Principle of the Identity of Indiscernibles (PII)
item.description: Summary of Leibniz's PII, which couples neatly with Borges's phenomenal equivalences.

item.title: The College-Admissions Crucible
item.description: Puts it better than I can: making a system full of chance out to be oracular isn't good for the folks involved.

item.title: Big Jill, Little Jimmy, Little Rosalynn, Big Joe
item.description: The Bidens/Carter photo is less notable for the optical effect itslef, and more for how neatly the optical effect accidentally fits a zeitgeist.

item.title: Hexagonal Grids
item.description: Comprehensive explainer of coordinate systems (cubic, radial) and drawing in hexagonal grids.

item.title: Donut Hole Stories
item.description: Characters and chess at Fillmore and California in the mid-seventies.

item.title: Introducing Vector Networks
item.description: Figma's improvements on existing bezier-oriented vector tools.
